event.name: VAMPWEED_SLAVES
event.text: "It ain't easy finding work nowadays! The moral fiber of the galactic work force has decayed! People don't want to work anymore. They don't show up, they're constantly demanding better pay while their productivity diminishes, it's a real pandemic! Wouldn't you agree?!" The slaver stares at you, waiting for your response.

event.name: VAMPWEED_SLAVES_2
event.text: Before you can even finish your sentence, the slaver cuts you off. "And THAT is why I'm excited to announce our brand new "loyal workers" program! Paid and provided for by Tiiikaka." The slaver flashes a grin and has his crew step out to peddle various 'workers'.
Slavers are the scum of the galaxy. You'll be doing great justice by wiping this one out.
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."
"A great purchase. May they serve you well, captain..."

choice.text: (Vampweed Crew) "We do not need your 'workers'. The Confederacy is strong thanks to the hardwork of us greenbloods."

event.text: "Ah, gross vine thing! I often forget your kind can even speak! Isn't it adorable, you sound like you'll grow up to be quite the little fascist some day!" The slaver pretends to pat your Orchid on the head. "Here you go little guy, have some scrap for all your hard work in the sweatshop."

choice.text: Ignore the slaver and continue on your way.

event.text: You're not interested in slavers.

choice.text: I don't feel comfortable answering that.

event.name: VAMPWEED_GARDEN
event.text: An Orchid vessel is passing through when it stops as you jump in. With proficient sign language, they hail you. "Captain, greetings! We're on a special mission from the Gathering at the request of Ambassador Ty E'Rel. A disease has overcome one of the local Confederate Gardenworlds and we've been sent to cure it! A small problem though... uh... we have no idea what we're doing. I know, I know, it's our job but like, I just water the plants? Our chief botanist was already out so they sent us instead. By chance, do you have anything that could help us?"

Ty E'Rel's poker face doesn't even flinch as he dresses down the Gathering delegation. "I am very disappointed in your performance. You did not leave with everything you needed to complete the task as requested. I will fax you some documents that will outline some basic procedures, but if you are unable to carry out your duties, then you will return to the Gathering and not come back until you are properly equipped."
The Gathering Delegation sheepishly accept his documents and promise to do better. "Um, we were given this Spore Launcher. Please be gentle in your performance review."

choice.text: Take this opportunity to attack them!

event.text: "Gah! Not another one!" The caretakers arm their weapons and ready to defend themselves.
Disappointed, the Orchids nod and prepare to carry on - unprepared.

The caretaker blinks, trying to process the information you just made up on the fly. "Uhuh... I'm not really sure what you're saying, but it sounds like you know what you're talking about!" The Orchids offer a gift for your 'help'.

"Everything you just said makes no sense. What the hell is a flagmin? A stephalimo? A lombone? Those aren't even real words! They... they don't even sound like they COULD be real! I was asking for real help, not cryptid botany." Frustrated, the Florals mute you and go back to preparing.

The Orchids are grateful for your advice, and offer you their sincerest thanks. "Here, the Confederates gave us a Spore Launcher to help protect ourselves, but so far we haven't had many issues. You can have it instead, it'll probably suit a military vessel better!"

The Orchids are grateful for your advice, and offer you their sincerest thanks. "Here, we were provided with map data for this sector to help us locate other local utilities, but it should come in use for you as well!"
The Orchids are grateful for your advice, and offer you their sincerest thanks. "Unfortunately we don't have too much to offer in ways of physical rewards, but we can provide some spare resources."

event.name: VAMPWEED_SCRAPYARD
event.text: A large scrapyard has been assembled nearby, littered with the scraps from factory rejects. A few Vampweed ships are guarding it, but considering no one else seems to be using it, maybe they'll let you in?
The Vampweeds shake their vines, urging you not to go in. "Trust me, you don't want to go in there! The scrapyard is haunted by a ghoul that steals people's likenesses! And it speaks in riddles!"

choice.text: There's a Vagabond in the scrapyard? We can take care of it.

event.text: "No, it's not a Vagabond! This is something supernatural! If I was a greenleaf I'd say it's a being from the afterlife, but this I think is just your ordinary demon. If you want to take the risk we won't stop you, but be warned!" Not deterred, you decide to explore the scrapyard yourself and assess the situation.

As your crew traverse the scrapyard in search of supplies and maybe a ghoul, you hear strange noises. "Pakooj! Makoo makoo tipple lajook!" A small grey blob jumps out from behind a scrap pile, taking on the form of one of your crew! The creature seems docile and despite your cautious movements follows you with childlike curiosity. Maybe you could bring this thing back with you? It could take a bit of time and effort...
The little blob makes itself at home on your ship once you manage to convince it to follow you back. As you prepare to leave, you notify the Vampweeds the situation's been taken care of.

choice.text: Ignore the blob and just bring back some scrap instead.

event.text: Although intrigued by the blob, you don't have time to go recruiting every mysterious and possibly sentient creature you come across. On your way back you inform the Vampweeds they should look into finding out the origins of the creature in case it's important for something.

In response to OOJ's presence, the little Morph wiggles with excitement. Seems you've found another of OOJ's children to tag along. If you had to guess, this thing snuck its way here aboard a scientist vessel.

choice.text: (Shell Scientist) Your Shell knows what this is.

event.text: It seems this blob is a Morph, one of the Geniocracy Science District's most recent creations and also their biggest mistake. Your Shell seems to think this Morph must have snuck its way aboard a scientist vessel and traveled all the way here. Although the creatures went rogue, controlling them should fortunately not be too difficult for your crew.

choice.text: That does sound spooky! We'll leave.

event.text: No way are you going to mess with the supernatural.
You have no use for whatever might be in there.

event.name: VAMPWEED_TERRAFORMING
event.text: A collection of terraforming vessels gathered around a large Gathering outpost that has been constructed around the nearby planet. You see vessels of both Confederate and Gathering origin, a rare display of unity between the two.

The terraforming group looks highly busy, although one of the foremen humor your questions. "Provision 16 of the Kadahellian'ek Treaty instated what is known as the 'Joint Conservation Act'. To help improve relations while providing essential service, the Gathering and Confederacy have set aside each a pool of resources to help in the process of terraforming potential host planets for new garden worlds." The Vampweed scratches their chin, inspecting your vessel. "You're military, I figure at least based on your weapons. Think you could do us a favor? The Gathering was insistent we sent down some monks to 'bless the grounds' before the process began, but we haven't heard back from them since. Mind taking a look into it? It'll save us a lot of trouble."

choice.text: (Caretaker Crew) Offer to send your own monk down to bless the grounds.

event.text: "I appreciate your offer, but you must understand simply sending a new team down isn't an option. If something bad happened to the first group, it could be a nightmare for PR. We have to ensure their safety first and foremost."
You see no particular reason to get involved here and decide to leave.

You send a team down to look for the Florals. Following their tracks, you eventually find they've set up a camp on the surface and are unconscious, their systems fully intoxicated by premium Confederate liquor. You report back their whereabouts to the terraforming team. "Damn it! I know I'm supposed to be... working with these people, but sometimes these Florals just get on my nerves! Ugh. I guess it's not like I haven't seen Vampweeds get as drunk too, but this is just annoying. Whatever, thanks for your help. I'll send someone to pay you for your time."

While searching for the monks, you find distressing amounts of sap and green blood on the face of some boulders. A little bit further leads you to the scene of several corpses and a Vampweed holding a blaster. "They think they can bring GREENLEAVES into our god damn sectors? Ivar has lost his MIND! The Confederacy is only as strong as it is clean from the taint of those communard zealots!"

choice.text: Leave quickly and report this to the terraformers.

event.text: It's obvious this man is unstable, and sticking around is a bad idea. The terraformers are distraught to hear about the slaughter. "Damn it! I... they're dead? All of them? Jeez, have we really come to this? Murdering unarmed monks on a diplomatic mission? This is going to be a PR nightmare... but thank you for handling this. If our teams had seen this, they might not have been able to control themselves.

choice.text: Try to take down the Vampweed on your own.

event.text: Completely outnumbered, your crew eliminate the madman quickly and easily. You report back your findings to the terraforming team, who are clearly distressed. "Damn it! This is bad... if the news gets out, this could ruin a decade's worth of diplomatic ties! Shit, shit... I wish you hadn't killed him! Taking him to court and making a display out of him might have been the only way to salvage this! Still, I appreciate you trying to help... Just... UGH! Shit, what am I going to do?!"

event.name: VAMPWEED_INJECTION
event.text: A Shell research station hails you nearby. "So you're a Renegade, right? I've heard thhhe likes of you tend to collect a menagerie of varied species aboard your ships. I'm part of thhhhe Cultivator project, helping develop and harvest thhhe spores used to manufacture bothhh Spore Launchers and Shell neurotoxin systems. Would you mind if I injected some of your crew withhhh poisonous spores to see what happens? If you have anythhhhing REALLY exotic I'll pay you extra!"

choice.text: Even MORE scientists that will have to look elsewhere for test dummies.
Submit one of your crew to testing.

event.text: Having drawn straws as per tradition, one of your crew reluctantly heads off to the lab to have god-knows-what injected into their bloodstream for the sake of science. The Shells seem confident in their experiments, but you can't say you have the same certainty.
"Er... I'm not sure what to really do with thhhhhis thhhing. It is exotic thhhhough, so I'll give you thhhat. Alright, let's see..."
"Er... I'm not sure what to really do with thhhhhis thhhing. It is exotic thhhhough, so I'll give you thhhat. Alright, let's see..."
"Er... I'm not sure what to really do with thhhhhis thhhing. It is exotic thhhhough, so I'll give you thhhat. Alright, let's see..."
"Er... I'm not sure what to really do with thhhhhis thhhing. It is exotic thhhhough, so I'll give you thhhat. Alright, let's see..."
"Er... I'm not sure what to really do with thhhhhis thhhing. It is exotic thhhhough, so I'll give you thhhat. Alright, let's see..."
The Shell shakes his head in shame at your lack of scientific curiosity and hangs up.

event.name: VAMPWEED_INJECTION_TEST_FAIL
event.text: A little while later you hear back from the Shell, who is clearly disappointed and upset. "It... it didn't work. Nothhhing happened at all! Thhhhe concentration must be wrong..." Despite the Shell's disappointment, you're just glad to have your crew back alive and well.

"YES! IT WORKED! Hahahah!" With such enthusiasm, you expect your crew to be returning soon. Instead, it appears they died shortly after the experiments began from the neurotoxins. The Shells offer only a slight apology, but are otherwise too caught up in their success to really pay attention to your woes.

removeCrew.text: For some reason, your Clone Bay doesn't seem to be registering your crew member. This must be something on behalf of the Shells, but you can't be certain.

choice.text: Attack the Shells to get revenge!

event.name: VAMPWEED_RIOT
event.text: Noticing a nearby inhabited planet, you pull closer to inspect the city and instead find chaos has taken over the streets. A Zoltan peacekeeper vessel lays in the middle of the streets while crowds of rioting Vampweeds are rocking its hull back and forth and trying to tear off its armor to get inside. Shouts can be heard - "We are tired of the Federation getting involved in our lives! You are not welcome here, energy freak!", and "Your days are numbered, Federation! Ivar's tainted line will trouble us no more!"

choice.text: Ask the city officials what is happening.

event.text: "Oh thank the lucky stars, backup has arrived? A Zoltan merchant was traveling through here earlier, and their escort docked here briefly and according to a witness, got drunk and started hitting on some women. The bar got mad and chased them out of the streets, chanting what-not about the Federation. I don't give a damn about politics right now. This kind of chaos has been happening ever since someone in the Premier's cabinet started a conspiracy against the government to overthrow Ivar and join the Coalition. We've tried, but we can't restore order on our own - can you please help us?"

choice.text: Fire on the crowd to make them disperse.

event.text: You march out of the city office and into the streets, chanting alongside the Vampweeds. They're fairly confused as to who you are or why you're there, but they see you have weapons and are eager to let you in on the chaos. You get sucked into the moment, completely losing focus on what you're doing or why you're there. By the time you snap back to reality, the Zoltan is dead, your cargo is full of stolen scrap, and a rioter seems to have pledged themselves to your crew.
No way are you risking your mission by getting involved in a violent riot like that. You pull away from the planet.

The rioters don't even listen to the words coming out of your mouth, and instead turn to shout insults at you. As you stumble back to your ship admist the boos, you find a couple drunken Vampweeds smacking the hull and trying to pry their way inside!

Your attempts to soothe the crowd don't do much more than draw their anger towards you, but it's just enough of a distraction to allow the Zoltans to power up their ship and fly away while local law enforcement swoops in to control the crowds. You're paid for your efforts by the city law enforcement.

"I'M DONE! I'M DONE!" Suddenly, before you can even react, the Zoltan comes crawling out and stands on top of their ship. "I'M DONE! You're right, you're right! The Federation was a mistake! Hahah! Sweet freedom!" The Zoltan leaps into the crowd, where he is beaten until his chassis implodes and the remaining scraps of armor are scavenged from between the piles of bodies scattered in the explosion. It's a gruesome and deranged scene, and certainly not at all what you expected to witness.
Despite the chaos, you're able to take some advantage of the situation and make away with some scrap from the hull of the Zoltan vessel.

You do your best to talk sense into the crowd, but suddenly a bomb goes off near the shipyards where you docked! Pandemonium takes control of the scene and the rioters scramble in all directions, trampling each other. The Zoltan peacekeeper sneaks out of their ship and approaches you. "Please, they'll never accept me back into the Ministry after this. You might be my only chance left to serve the Federation - and more importantly, find some way for the academy to forgive me!"

Your choice to fire on the crowd impresses no one, least of all city law enforcement. The rioters turn even more violent rather than dispersing, and the unprepared city defense rushes in against their better judgement to gain any control they can over the situation. You are asked to leave, "as soon as your last two brain cells can remember how to activate your FTL drive".

Firing on the crowd is certainly the most violent option, but it does force the crowds to disperse - or at least those who still have legs to run away with after being fired upon. Both medical officials and law enforcement arrive to evacuate those injured, and the city leaders aren't too pleased with you. Who is pleased, however, is the Zoltan you just saved. They promise to give a good report about your help to the Ministry and offers some supplies.

event.name: VAMPWEED_FIRE
event.text: A few signs of industrial infrastructure dot the space around the beacon, guiding your eyesight towards what appears to be a Vampweed factory that's currently ablaze!

You rush aboard the factory station, trying to survey the damage. However, most of the station seems perfectly fine. Despite obvious charring, the flames themselves have been extinguished in most of the important areas and the crew is huddled in one of the assembly rooms. One of the factory directors notices your presence. "Oh, Renegades. I... appreciate your hasty effort to save the day, but there was no need. All Confederate factories are by law required to have sufficient fire suppressant systems installed in case of emergencies like this. However, since you're here, we could use some help."
The Vampweed pulls a small canteen full of some lightly intoxicating beverage and takes a few sips. "Fires like this don't usually happen by accident. Our equipment is top notch and our workers are trained well. Seems to me the only probable cause was some kind of Greenleaf communard, trying to destabilize the heart of the capitalist industry! Damn Florals despise our flourishing economy, they say the Gathering council is being pressured to revise their economic system now that the Confederacy has surpassed them. A Gathering ship was seen passing through here a few days ago. Do me a favor and track them down, and see to it that justice is served. I'll pay you handsomely."

choice.text: Agree to track down the Floral.

event.text: Like the Vampweed warned, after not too much exploring you find a Floral vessel. They're fairly startled to see you, and rapidly rush through some sequences of sign language. "Federation! I was not expecting this. You are friendly I hope?" Wasting no time, you ask them about the fire and they send back a few more messages. "The fire? Yes, it was a terrible tragedy. We were not there, but we did see it passing by. Would have helped, but their kind can be aggressive even when we're only trying to aid them..." Something about the way they used 'their kind' rubs you the wrong way, but is it enough to accuse them?

While you still aren't entirely certain if they're responsible, the evidence seems stacked against them. The Florals, while scared, don't protest against your aggression and instead prepare to defend themselves!

choice.text: Return to the Vampweeds and tell them the Florals aren't responsible.

event.text: You bid farewell to the Florals and return to the factory, with its fire now mostly extinguished. "They're not responsible? Seriously? I can't tell if you're just stupid or if you're a co-conspirator!" The Vampweed takes a deep breath in and puts away his canteen. "Sorry, I'm stressed out and I've been drinking a bit too much lately. I appreciate you trying to help us. The Federation can't be so bad if it's got people like you. I'm sure my men can find a way to help you."
"Fine then. I suppose it should be expected the Federation butcher would choose to side with the Gathering in the end. At least you TRIED to put out this fire..."

choice.text: We can't risk the mission, we shouldn't get involved.

event.text: You have no use for whatever might be in there.

event.name: VAMPWEED_FIRE_WIN
event.text: By the time you return to the factory most of the fire has been put out already. "I KNEW they were responsible. Kadahellian'ek was a mistake, we never should have tried to make peace with these filthy greenleaves! Thank you for your help. I'll see to it my men give you something for your trouble on your way out.

event.name: VAMPWEED_THEFT
event.text: Two vessels are trading near the beacon, one a Union ship and the other a Confederate. Not too long after the two vessels part ways with their new cargo in tow. You could chase after one of them and try to take their cargo, if you think you could kill their crew quickly enough.
You power up your weapons and fly after the Union vessel, hoping to seize its cargo.
You power up your weapons and fly after the Confederate vessel, hoping to seize its cargo.
You're not a pirate, and you're not going to go chasing down and robbing innocent civilians like this.
The Union ship was carrying a brand new Spore Launcher! You grab the weapon and take it back to the ship.
The Union ship was carrying a Vampweed drone schematic! You grab the schematics and take them back to the ship.
The Union ship's cargo unfortunately doesn't contain anything special. The trade must not have gone through, but you do find extra supplies to take with you.
The Confederate ship was carrying a standard Burst Laser! You grab the weapon and take it back to the ship.
The Confederate ship was carrying a specialized utility weapon! You grab it and take it back to the ship.
The Confederate ship's cargo doesn't contain anything that seems to belong to the Union. The trade must not have gone through, but you do notice some map data and resources to take back with you.

event.name: VAMPWEED_BADREBEL
event.text: The dark blue hull of a Rebel vessel straight out of Universe 1 is orbiting the area, patrolling for ships. In the background, it seems a Vampweed colony has just recently been torched to the ground.

The captain catches sight of your vessel and immediately sends a hail. "My my, what do we have here? My lucky day, once again! Well, every day is lucky when you stand with the Rebellion! Admiring my handywork?" The Rebel moves his hand in the general direction of the burning colony. "Thing is, I was sent on an express mission by Van-1 to harass Federation allies in this reality, put the fear of humanity in them. Thing is... there's really not much a difference between the weeds, is there? Both are just pests you have to pluck from the garden, so the bigger stronger species can survive."
Beneath the smug sneer you sense a bit of regret, desperately being hidden beneath a blanket of false bravado. "The Confederation is halfway between the Feds and the Coalition anyways. No matter what they choose, they're more of a problem than the Florals."

"Hmph! As if you're the moral authority on what's justified! You think the Federation's hands are any cleaner than ours? We're in total war. Anything goes, as long as it gets you to the end. You're a butcher for a bureaucracy built on the reluctant shoulder of tyrants, and I'm an agent for the glory of mankind. For Universe 1!"

Jerry shakes his head sadly. "Listen to what you're saying. These people have done nothing to you. Even if you have to follow orders, even if you must wage war... can't you at least spare respect for innocent civilians?"
The Rebel's face grows pale. "I... Jerry? What's he doing here?" The Rebel swallows. "But... they aren't... they don't deserve..." One of the other Rebels pulls him away, and soon his first officer steps in. "I don't know if we fully agree with what you're saying. But the rest of us want to prove to you we can do better than this. The captain will spend the rest of his time in the brig. Please, I hope you will forgive us. And in return, we'll keep the fleet off your back."

"You truly sicken me. You who does not value life, but only dogma. Spreading your sickness far beyond your contaminated universe of origin." Mayeb's glare intensifies. She points at the Rebel on the screen. "Your kind connotes weeds as unwanted, spreading far outside their domain. Can't you understand that the acts you're committing destroy so much more than an Earth weed ever could?"
The Rebel growls, but seems to digest what she is saying - he slows down as he tries to formulate a response. His response is stilted: "We humans... are only sticking together... making a world where we could prosper." He shakes his head. "A weed could never understand!" He terminates comms before Mayeb can respond. Conflict was inevitable.

Ty E'Rel straightens his posture and clears his throat. "Us 'weeds' as you call us have a much greater difference in genetic diversity than you humans. While we can interbreed, we are different subspecies. Yes, the Gathering and the Confederacy have conflicted with each other, but we are still able to cooperate. Can you say the same? You aren't even a different species than the humans in your Federation. That which would slaughter its own... would you really want such a plant in your garden?"
The human seems stumped. "You..." After stuttering for a moment, he activates his ship's weapons. "Plants will always be lesser. You can't stomach what it takes to make your kind stronger!"

Ivar blinks, seemingly needing a moment to process his emotions about the colony that was destroyed. "You're right about one thing there, buddy." Ivar says. "The Orchids are more similar than many give us credit for. We won't always be at each other's throats. We'll learn from each other and better each other. Some day, I will petition for the Confederacy to join the Federation. The Rebellion will wish we had stayed neutral, and the Federation will be stronger than it has ever been!"
"You stupid... bumbling plant! If the humans couldn't make the Federation strong, then no species can. The Federation will be your downfall!" The Rebel proceeds to approach you with hostile intent!

choice.text: (Floral Crew) "You slaughter my kind! You deserve swift retribution. May the tree of life have mercy on your soul."

event.text: "Hmph. Your advanced technology betrays the outdated customs of your species, plant! You will die amongst all your Federation friends, standing for nothing more than a Multiverse polluted by broken dreams and a false sense of unity." Even as he orders his crew to attack, you can sense the Rebel's heart isn't quite in it. Still, he carries out the orders anyways, meaning conflict is inevitable.

choice.text: (Vampweed Crew) "Uncivilized monsters! That colony posed no threat to you!"

event.text: "What you call uncivilized I call a day's work spreading the glory of the Rebellion. We are the future, and if you can't accept that, then history will forget you." Even as he orders his crew to attack, you can sense pain in the Rebel's heart from the words your Vampweed spoke. Still, he carries out the orders anyways, meaning conflict is inevitable.

choice.text: I literally do not care, please just stop talking.

event.text: The Rebel scowls at your insult but says nothing more. You expect conflict, but instead he just stays silent.

event.name: VAMPWEED_CAMPAIGN
event.text: From nearby, you receive a hail from a Shell science vessel. "Hey, you. I don't care who you are or why you're here, I need your help. You have guns, right? Well I need someone who knows how to fire thhhheir guns very, very precisely. Thhhhink thhhat describes you?"

"We have some friends, some Vamps, who've gotten thhhhemselves into some trouble. Namely, thhhey're convinced thhhat Ayr would be a better leader than Ivar, and thhhat thhhe Confederacy would really be better off in thhhhe Coalition. If thhhat were to... go thhhhrough... well it'd be thhhe end of our current scientific alliance. Thhhe Geniocracy is adamant on refusing all offers to join thhhe Coalition. We do thhhings our own way and pick our own allies. And also, we're not working withhh any damn Slugs. Could you do us a favor and... knock some sense into our friends? Make sure thhhey understand the gravity of thhhheir situation, if you catch my drift."

You navigate to the coordinates given to you by the Shells and lock onto the Vampweed vessel. Immediately, they begin shouting insults at you. "Butcher! Federation assassin! You're no better than a Rebel!" The stale, lifeless way in which they shout these cookie cutter phrases leads you to believe these aren't the brightest nor most inspired believers the Coalition has ever attracted.

choice.text: Attack them to force them into compliance!

event.text: The only way to convince these guys requires force. Just don't go too hard on them - the Shells don't want them dead.

choice.text: This isn't worth our time, leave.

event.text: The Shell grunts in annoyance and hangs up.
The other end goes silent and the call terminates immediately.

event.name: VAMPWEED_CAMPAIGN_SURRENDER
event.text: "You've beaten us, pig! We get it, the Federation has no moral limits to how far it will go to enforce supreme sovereignty over all people!"

choice.text: We're not here to harass you - your friends are concerned about you.

event.text:
"My friends hired a Renegade to almost kill me? I don't care the reason, that's just cold! These Shells sometimes, I swear." The Vampweed scratches their petals. "Well, I guess it's a taste of what life is like being with the Coalition. To be honest, I didn't even know Renegades had the self control to not kill everyone they see."
The Vampweed sighs. "Fine, I guess I'll give up this Coalition business for now. Keyword is 'for now'. I will consider the alternatives and weigh which side is better."

"Good, you brought at least a little sense into thhhhem. Thhhhe Federation may not be my favorite assembly, but it suits thhhe interests of thhhe galaxy much better thhhan thhhe Coalition. Here, have thhhis as a reward."

event.name: VAMPWEED_ALKRAM
event.text: A Leech revolutionary flies past you at breakneck speeds, but suddenly stops and reverses. An out of breath and overweight Leech appears on your vidscreen. "Huff... huff... The brink of war is nigh! It is now that the consequences of our actions are more paramount than ever before! The damned fool Tyrdeo has put doom on the agenda of the Republic. But I shan't be witness to the end. I shall fight! Fight to save the Republic, fight to save the galaxy! I will right the wrongs before their motion cannot be undone."

choice.text: Why are you talking like a Phantom?

event.text: "Er... is it not working? I was told it would make me sound smarter. If it's not working I'll just stop, because it's really hurting my brain. As you may or may not already know, President Tyrdeo of the Eargen Republic is currently engaged in a civil war, and the Confederacy has taken the side of the revolutionaries. I was chosen by our leader, Alkram, to ensure relations stay positive. I was supposed to bring a gift to the embassy here... but uhm... I have no idea what to bring. The last two times a Leech presented a diplomatic gift to another head of state, it caused an all-out war. I don't really want to be the third."

choice.text: Come up with some random ideas.
Offer a gift of your own.

event.text: "Wow, really? This is so much! Thank you, Renegade. Maybe this mission won't be a failure after all. There's hope yet for the Republic."
Before they leave, the Leeches offer you a gift of gratitude, including a previous token candidate for the embassy.

choice.text: (Orchid Children) Offer some corpses as a gift.

event.text:
"................................."
The Leech is silent for a few moments. "You insult our history? This is exactly how Tyrdeo began this war in the first place! You idiot, we will not tolerate such a flagrant jab at our history!"

choice.text: (Alkram) Alkram wishes to have a word.

event.text:
Alkram moves forward towards the comms, and as he gets closer the Leech on the other end withdraws slightly. He soon speaks up in a commanding tone.
"It seems you misunderstood my assignment to you. No, I did not instruct you to bring a gift to the embassy. My instructions were for you to show the embassy the finest of what we can offer them, by which I meant our unshakeable prowess in combat. However, I suppose this scenario is better than unintentionally provoking yet another conflict. There is no shame to be found in seeking wisdom from others for such matters. Now, come with me, soldier, and we shall demonstrate our finest to the Confederacy, together!" Encouraged by such a strong speech, the other Leech joins your crew, bringing along a weapon they had in their storage.
"Shit!" The Leech hangs up and flies off again at high speeds.
Any revolutionary is a traitor to their nation. Furthermore - this is a chance for scrap! Arm the guns!

choice.text: Ignore the rambling Leech and leave.

event.text: You mute the Leech in the middle of his grand speech and fly away.

You brainstorm for a few moments and spit out a couple ideas for the Leeches. They appreciate your effort, but none of the ideas satisfy them. Panicking about what fate will await them when they return, they decide to abandon ship and ask if they can come with you.

You brainstorm for a few moments and spit out a couple ideas for the Leeches. "I... I don't think you understand what we're looking for. This is supposed to be a diplomatic mission." The Leech sighs, then rushes off again at high speeds to find a solution - or someone who can come up with a better solution than you.

You brainstorm for a few moments and spit out a couple ideas for the Leeches. "Hm... one of those could work. Yeah... I'm still not sure about this, but anything's better than a bundle of flowers, right?"

event.name: VAMPWEED_CARGO
event.text: A Confederate vessel is protecting a loading platform with various assortments of cargo. From the looks of it, it'll all be shipping out soon. If you want to take advantage of this, you'll have to act quickly. That is of course, if you're willing to risk losing the Confederacy's respect.

choice.text: Attack the ship to access the cargo!

event.text: You arm the weapons and engage the Vampweed ship.

choice.text: (Upg. Cloaking) Sneak up on the platform and steal the cargo stealthily.

event.text: What good is pilfering through any supplies you see if that gets you the ire of anyone you come in contact with? You're better than that.
Inside the cargo container you find a Spore Launcher! You grab the model and bring it back to your ship.

While searching through the cargo, you're surprised to find a Vampweed hiding in one of the shipping containers! "Wait, wait! Please, don't tell anyone I'm here. I need to get out of this sector - I was a whistleblower that revealed corrupt practices in one of the local corporations, and now they want me dead! I can be useful, please just help me get out of here!"
Inside the cargo you find nothing except extra supplies. Not particularly exciting, but you aren't complaining.
Inside the cargo you find drone schematics for a specialized Vampweed drone. You download them to your ship.

event.name: DISTRESS_VAMPWEED_NOFUEL
event.text: You're a bit surprised to find a Federation vessel nearby, the source of the distress beacon. They hail you almost immediately. "Good, a friendly face! We ran out of fuel on the way through this sector, and we're terrified of what will happen if a Coalition or a hostile Confederate fleet passes through. Could you spare any fuel?"
"Thanks so much! It's not a ton, but it may be just enough to get us to a store or even out of the sector!"
"Thanks so much! This should be just enough to get out of danger and maybe even to our destination!"
"Thanks so much! This should be more than enough to get to our destination!"
"Hey, wait, what are you doing?!" You mute the Federation captain and get prepared to fight.

The Federation captain nods, although clearly still terrified. "Okay... I understand. Good luck against the Flagship, captain. Even if we don't make it - it's all worth it as long as this reality is safe!"

event.name: DISTRESS_VAMPWEED_DELUSION
event.text: The distress beacon here is coming from a Confederate government building, which seems to have been taken hostage by a band of Vampweed radicals! An aging Vampweed carrying a rather large gun paces back and forth, spouting delusional ramblings about the Federation-Mantis war and how Premier Ivar has betrayed them all. From the sounds of it, it almost seems like he thinks the war is still on-going!

choice.text: Robots are not particularly known for their ability to defuse these situations in a diplomatic manner.
Try to send some crew in there to defuse the situation.
(Ty E'Rel) "I am the one who presided over those negotiations."

event.text: The Vampweed immediately aims his attention directly towards Ty E'Rel. He starts spewing vitriol about how the negotiations were handled, but Ty E'Rel is able to swiftly counter every one of his talking points, being both more sound of mind and also having direct knowledge of what he's talking about. The radical sputters trying to counter his arguments, and is thoroughly distracted as the law enforcements seize him. The Confederates are pleased that you brought the perfect person for the job.

choice.text: (Human Crew) Send in your human as a 'Federation Ambassador'.

event.text: Your human approaches the Vampweed cautiously, pretending to be a direct representative of the Federation. The Vampweed immediately buys it, and after a few painful minutes of deliberation you distract the terrorist enough for law enforcement to seize him. You're rewarded for your efforts.

choice.text: (Leech Crew) Send in your Leech as a 'fellow soldier'.

event.text: Your Leech cautiously approaches the Vampweed, pretending to believe the same delusions of the war. The Vampweed buys it immediately, and to your surprise offers to go with you! You're unsure about it, but your crew assures you his delusions are so deep he won't be of any concern.

choice.text: (Hive Mantis Crew) Send in your Mantis as a 'fellow soldier'.

event.text: Your Mantis cautiously approaches the Vampweed, pretending to believe the same delusions of the war. The Vampweed buys it immediately, and to your surprise offers to go with you! You're unsure about it, but your crew assures you his delusions are so deep he won't be of any concern.
There's nothing you can do here to ease the situation. It's best to just leave it alone.

"The Federation has sent assassins to silence me! I knew this day would come! I won't go without a fight!" The Vampweed pushes a button on a remote control device, and an explosion engulfs the building! All but one of your crew make it back, but there's countless casualties inside.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your Clone Bay provides insurance against explosions. Your crew member is revived shortly after.

event.text: Your crew barely manage to negotiate with the Vampweed at all. Eventually, talking becomes pointless and they're forced to shoot him, but not before he takes the life of several hostages. It's a terrible situation and the Vampweeds barely even recognize your efforts to help.

Your crew manage to talk the Vampweed into surrendering, but only barely. The situation is still precarious as law enforcement arrives on scene, but the Confederates recognize your efforts and pay you.

event.name: DISTRESS_VAMPWEED_LOST
event.text:
Two Engi aboard the nearby vessel appear to be debating each other. "You are [reading] the map wrong. The Floral sector is he-he-he-here! This is Confederate space."
"I lack: understanding. I was informed that Orchids welcome all -peaceful- refugees. Are Confederates not: Orchids?"

After a few moments, the two Engi realize you're listening and panic. "You heard: nothing. Any suggestions this v-v-v-vessel is no longer in service of the Harmony = complete nonsense and is to be disregarded immediately."

choice.text: You both sound like Separatists. Are you lost?
(Harmony Crew) "Speech patterns match known Harmony vocals by only 30%. Evidence suggests: Separatist influence."

event.text: The two Separatists glance at each other then back at your Engi, then scramble to press the jump button. Their ship escapes before you can react.

choice.text: Just nod and leave them alone.

event.text: You have no reason to intrude on their business, and decide to carry on.

event.name: DISTRESS_VAMPWEED_LOST_HELP
event.text:
The two Engi whisper to each other before deciding you won't be a threat to them. "We were sent [by] the Harmony to calibrate a haywire Federation defense system in the adjacent sector. However, once we became d-d-d-disconnected from the Harmony... we decided we do not: wish to return."
The other Engi nods. "We were told that refuge for all lifeforms could be found in Orchid territory. On our w-w-way there... we got lost. This, I do not believe, is the -correct- sector. Maybe you can assist?"
You attempt to make up directions, but it's not very convincing. The Engi pay you sparsely in case your efforts were legitimate, but they aren't too grateful.

choice.text: (Separatist Crew) Offer directions to the nearest Separatist sector.

event.text: Both Engi are very grateful for your assistance and pay you handsomely. "Thank you. Because of your efforts - there is a chance we will av-av-avoid: recycling. Stay safe."

choice.text: (Floral Crew) Offer directions to the nearest Gathering sector.

event.text: Both Engi are very grateful for your assistance and pay you handsomely. "Thank you. Because of your efforts - there is a chance we will av-av-avoid: recycling. Stay safe."

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Offer directions to the nearest Gathering sector.

event.text: Both Engi are very grateful for your assistance and pay you handsomely. "Thank you. Because of your efforts - there is a chance we will av-av-avoid: recycling. Stay safe."

event.name: VAMPWEED_AUTO
event.text:
A Confederate factory is humming away with usual business, and you're about to pass it by when you notice a bulletin board has been posted outside with a job offer.
It reads; "Looking for: Combat ready vessel willing to sabotage Rebels. If interested, speak to manager."

You reach out to the factory's manager, who's eager to explain the issue. "As you may or may not know, the Confederacy takes up the large majority of intergalactic manufacturing for drones and other automated equipment. Even Arcadia outsources to us, because we're just that efficient! Thing is, I was thinking it's about time we step up our game. Why stop at drones? Let's think bigger! I'm talking Auto-ships, baby! I just need to get my hands on a Rebel Auto-ship, and I don't feel like paying them for it. So, if you're willing, I can forward the co-ordinates of an automated Rebel hangar nearby. Just take out their security and we can do the rest. Deal?"
"Excellent! This is an unusual scenario but I don't mind paying you up-front - I trust you'll do the task since it suits both of our best interests well."
You don't have time for spare oddjobs. You ignore the bulletin and carry on.

event.name: VAMPWEED_AUTO_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Vampweed has contracted you to secure an Auto-ship at a nearby Rebel hangar.

event.text: You've tracked down the coordinates of the Rebel hangar. A singular active Auto-ship is protecting the area.
"Hostile ship detected in protected zone. Activating deterrence mode."
You've changed your mind about completing the job.

"Great work! I'm shocked there was only one drone protecting the area, but I guess the Rebels don't care too much about their Auto-ships, do they? I know I already paid you, but here. Have a drone schematic, on the house."

"Great work! I'm shocked there was only one drone protecting the area, but I guess the Rebels don't care too much about their Auto-ships, do they? I know I already paid you, but here. Have a reactor upgrade, on the house."

event.name: VAMPWEED_AMBASSADOR
event.text: A Federation vessel lingers nearby, its systems still active but with clear signs something is wrong. The ship responds to no hails or any other form of communication, and drifts aimlessly through space.

choice.text: Board and see if anyone needs help.

event.text: While scrapping the ship, you find a choking Federation captain. You pull them out from under some collapsed debris, and once they've recovered they thank you. They inform you they were sent to escort a Federation ambassador on a diplomatic mission to the Confederacy when they were attacked by a Coalition vessel. The life signatures of the ambassador are still being tracked - you might still be able to save them!

You move in to scrap the hull, still wondering if the ship will react. It doesn't, and your salvage mission goes completely undisturbed. Maybe you could have done something to help, but now your cargo is lined with extra scrap.
You don't have time to go investigating every mysterious ship you stumble across, even if they're Federation.

event.name: VAMPWEED_AMBASSADOR_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Life signs of a Federation ambassador are tracked here.

event.text: Following the ambassador's life signatures has led you to a Coalition base. Activity seems to be as usual, save for even further increased security. They're refusing all hails.

choice.text: Engage the station and force them to give up the ambassador.

event.text: As far as you can tell, there's only two ways to get the ambassador out of this. One; force the Coalition to give up somehow, or two; get rid of all the security. Neither will be easy, so get ready to fight!
You've decided maybe engaging this Coalition station isn't the greatest idea.

The ambassador is a young human woman, likely no older than her early thirties. "Oh thank god, I'm alive. I thought for certain it was only a matter of time before they executed me. This Slug, the one in charge... he was so furious. He called the ones who took me captive reckless. God... people think their actions just don't have consequences anymore, do they? This is the sort of thing that starts wars."
She dusts off her shoulders and sighs. "You're the Renegade from Universe 0, if I'm not mistaken. Thank you for your service to the Federation. Please, drop me off at the nearest allied station so I may contact the Federation. In the meantime I'll pull some strings and see if I can help solve some of your pressing concerns..."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_VAMPWEED
textList.text: "The Federation clings to the past, but you shall find it will be your own undoing for pushing us away! When Ivar sees the truth and joins the Coalition, your hypocritical leaders will be annihilated! And until then, we'll have to make do with picking off you intrusive Universe 0 Renegades!"

Following the Federation-Mantis war, it was agreed during the Kadahellian'ek Treaty that the Gathering and Confederacy would never enter war against each other. Despite this, tensions remain high, and it seems many Vampweeds still hold history against the Federation. One particularly radical vessel nearby locks onto you!

Vampweeds might not be your friends, but it's not too typical for them to act in such aggressive manners. However, scans show the crew of the nearby ship have succumbed to some kind of parasite that creates irrational behavior. Prepare to fight!

"And so it's true, the Federation has finally sent Renegades to renew the old war! Well, we won't take this insult without a fight, scum!" Unfortunately, the ship refuses to listen to you, meaning a fight is inevitable.

A drunk Vampweed factory worker's vessel lurches towards you. "Ehhh... dumbass... Feds in my sector? You'll regret this, hear me!" Despite barely being able to form a coherent sentence, the captain is able to order his crew to attack!

Vampweeds are known to drink a fair bit as a culture, and intoxicated Orchids aren't an uncommon sight here. Unfortunately, the side effects of heavy drinking tend to cause irrational decisions, such as engaging Renegades in combat!
"I didn't side with the Hive during the old war, but now? Now I think I should have! The Federation has done nothing but push us away when we needed it most, and you're going to regret that!"

"Ivar has grown weak in trying to defend you Federation filth! It is time for insurrection, time to plant the seeds of rebellion so that it may flower into a galaxy where your lies no longer corrupt our youth!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_VAMPWEED_STATION
event.text: "Stop right there! This sector is a designated safe zone, non-Confederate military vessels are forbidden from entering this region!" You don't remember seeing such restrictions posted anywhere, but it seems you don't have time to argue. Get ready to fight!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_COALITION_VAMPWEED
textList.text: "The Federation had its chance over a century ago, but still you cling to this galaxy as if you really represent anything but a dying age! Your stake at the Confederacy is long past nullified, so you might as well roll over dead and allow the inevitable to happen!" Seemingly hoping to make rolling over dead more than a metaphor, the Coalition vessel attacks!

Unfortunately, in light of the Federation's reluctance to welcome the Vampweeds, a large number of Confederate nationalists have taken it personally and are pushing to join the Coalition instead. This has resulted in an influx of Coalition vessels in their territory - not a good thing for you!

"You claim to represent peace and prosperity, yet where were you when the Confederacy came knocking? When your so called 'mission of unification' really came to the test, the whole galaxy got to see exactly why the Federation must fall. Your claim to this reality, U0 scum, is nullified in the wake of the Coalition! You will be eradicated!"

The Slug captain of the nearby Coalition vessel hails you, barely holding onto consciousness. "Thessse... Vampweedssss know their way around alcohol, hah! Oh I'm going to... *hiccup* regret thissss in the morning..." A morning he may never see, because as soon as he registers you're a Renegade he decides to open fire!

"In old war, I fight on behalf of Hive and gain brotherhood with Confederacy. While those days over, the brotherhood never dies! Whether it is the alliance of past or Coalition of future, we will strike Federation scum down!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_LEECH_VAMPWEED
textList.text: "The Republic will rise again! And the Coalition will be the one to do it! Yeah... probably! I actually don't have much confidence in this, but I was told yelling would make you sound sure of yourself! Now I'm embarrassed and I'm going to fight you anyways! I will regret this!"

The Confederacy has for a while now been playing a part in aiding the revolutionaries against Tyrdeo in the Eargen Republic. All of this, confusingly, has been going on meanwhile as a significant percentage of the Confederacy has been pushing to join the Coalition - of which the Republic is a founding member. This confusing jumble of politics has left many to wonder who is on who's side - such as the lost Leech vessel nearby who's weapons lock onto you out of instinct as soon as you approach!

"You should have taken the chance to welcome the Confederacy while you could, Federation scum! Now you stand even weaker in the face of the Coalition! We'll pave over you and build a new galaxy free of your tyranny!"

It seems everyone universally enjoys the sweet mixtures of Vampweed alcohol - or at least particularly violent drunks do. A Republic captain, having just finished raiding a Confederate bar, orders an attack on your vessel admist a drunken stupor.

A vessel from the Eargen Republic is making back and forth patrols of the area, weapons still charged from some prior encounter, likely with the Confederate military. When they spot you, they lock on and attack!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MANTIS_VAMPWEED
textList.text: "I mark your vessel rightfully property of mine, for entering Krakiiil hunting ground! I will chop out bloated liver and sell to plant as scientific curiosity!"

The Hive and the Confederacy aided each other back in the days of the Federation-Mantis war. Though that alliance has since fallen apart, the Confederacy has retained some archaic open border laws allowing Mantis hunters into their territory - as long as it's ships like yours they're hunting, and not their own.
"Do you smell that? It is the scent of murder on horizon. Your corpse will making fine decoration for my vessel, as reminder for how old war should have ended!"

"Renegade, I slaughter you like I slaughter Federation back in days of old war! It is nothing personal, really. I am just missing those days of red blood running in trenches. And also, I don't like you."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_VAMPWEED
textList.text: "The Confederacy has put countless millions of honest Unionists out of business, outcompeting them with their unsanitary and inhumane working conditions in their sweatshop factories! Yet you, Federation scum, you would rather 'keep the peace' and allow this kind of conduct to continue! It's despicable!"

The Confederacy has drawn the ire of quite a few humans, who see the raw industrial power of the Vampweeds as a threat to the Union's dominance on galactic manufacturing. Of course, the Rebels have taken this to the extreme and are now making unprovoked attacks on Confederate space!

"If I had a penny for every time I've run into a Renegade in some random backwater alien sector, I'd have... well, I'd have one penny because this is the first time it's happened. But it keeps happening to my friends too, so it's still kind of a weird coincidence."

"The Union opened its arms to the galaxy, and offered an honest chance to any xeno willing to take it! And how were we repaid? The Confederacy spat in our hand and built its own industrial empire with half the moral fiber! They call themselves capitalists, but they're nothing more than a money farming parasite!" The Rebel spits on the ground and decides to take out his frustration on you.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_VAMPWEED_ELITE
event.text: "The Confederacy is not the stomping grounds of the Federation or its hitmen! Your presence here violates the basic rights of any person to enjoy peace and prosperity without the invasion of intrusive foreign governments!" A proud Cultivator, claiming to act in the goodwill of his people, raises his weapons and attacks your ship!

event.name: VAMPWEED_STORE_RESTAURANT
event.text: As you arrive, you're barraged with an oppressive array of advertisements surrounding a Vampweed store. The nearest billboard displays a popular diner chain attached to the station. As you check out the restaurant, you notice that there's two Vampweed ships docking, so the restaurant might be crowded.

You make your way inside. The restaurant is mostly full, with the crews of both ships taking up several booths. In the back is the smoking section, where you can see the ranking officers. They seem to be in the middle of talking about something.
Try as you might, you can't get close - every booth near them is full of Vampweeds. You might have to convince them to let you through.
You eat your Vampweed cuisine with your own crew, not mingling with the servicemen at all. It's tasty, but the meal is uneventful.

Ty E'Rel marches up to the table. "Good evening. Is there something we can help you with?"
"Ambassador E'Rel! We were just... Well, we're worried. The civilian offices are telling us to avoid Central Command, and we don't know why."
"...I think I know. We'll head over there at once."
"Just like that? ...Well, you don't have to go alone. We can lend you our finest officer."

Ivar plops himself next to the officers. Their reaction is immediate - they salute. "I-Ivar! To what do we owe the pleasure?"
"Something tells me you're worried, lads. What seems to be the problem?"
"Of course we're worried! The civilian offices are telling us to avoid Headquarters, and we don't know why."
"Oh, we can investigate, don't worry. Hopefully by the time we're through, everything will be okay."
"Just like that? ...Well, you don't have to go alone. We can lend you our finest officer."
You eat your Vampweed cuisine with your own crew, not mingling with the Vampweeds at all. It's tasty, but the meal is uneventful.
You focus on shopping, leaving you plenty of time on your ship.

event.name: DINE_WITH_VAMPWEEDS
event.text: The Vampweed crew eye you suspiciously. They don't seem keen to let you join them. "What do YOU want?"
"Ay! This Federation captain's buying drinks!" Upon ordering the alcohol, the Vampweeds immediately warm up to you. As your crews mingle, one of the Vampweeds even asks to join your crew.

choice.text: (Tuco) Intimidate the restaurant owner into giving a round to the crew.

event.text: Tuco slams the counter. "HEY! Don't you see the mood of this place? What are you running, a diner or a mausoleum? You'd best serve up every table a bottle of wine on the house or I'll crash my way back there and do it myself!" The manager trembles and directs the waitresses to acquiesce. A round of drinks is distributed throughout the diner, and the Vampweeds are more than happy to have you join them. As your crews mingle, one of them even asks to join your crew.
You keep to yourself and the Vampweeds leave you alone.

event.name: DINER_EAVESDROP_VAMPWEEDS
event.text:
You carefully seat yourself near enough to the officers that you can hear them without crossing their line of sight. They seem apprehensive. By the time you catch up to them, they're tensely talking about something innocuous, before one of them eventually diverts back to the topic at hand.
"Are you absolutely sure...? Absolutely nothing?"
"I'm telling you, headquarters went completely radio silent. Met another patrol on the way, they haven't heard anything either."
"Maybe HQ's communications systems are down?"
"Doesn't explain why we can't reach any other ship in that area. And..." The officer's voice quiets down. "I wasn't supposed to mention this - I got orders from the civilian offices routing my patrols away from stars I almost always go through, including Sigma Reticulus."
"Sigma Reticulus... So you were ORDERED to stay away from the Headquarters? But the order didn't come from Headquarters itself? This doesn't sound good..."
"Maybe we should stop discussing this. I don't want to lose my commission for asking too many questions." An awkward silence falls over the officers.

choice.text: Jot down the star system they mentioned.

event.text: Your navigation system is able to locate the nearest beacon to that star, and presumably their headquarters.

event.name: VAMPWEED_SECURITY_CRUISER_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Vampweed Security HQ went dark here.

event.text: A Coalition vessel hovers menacingly over the HQ, nearly side-by-side with a damaged Vampweed Cruiser drifting through orbit- all contrasted by the dead-silent security alarms planetside. The Coalition hails you. "I had a feeling you'd sssshow up, Renegade. Your kind hassss alwaysss sssstuck their nosssse where it doesssn't belong. The Confederacy will never be your ally! Their dessstiny is with the greatessst faction in the galaxy - the Coalition!" As they start attacking you, you notice that you've been boarded by some Cultivators!

event.name: VAMPWEED_SECURITY_RESCUE
event.text: Coalition elites are a formidable foe, especially with Vampweeds among their number. The Agency contacts you shortly after your victory, just as you start scrapping the Coalition ship.

The agency's director appears on your screen. "How fitting that we are saved by a Renegade after an attack by the Coalition! You have our eternal gratitude! I cannot think of a better way to repay you than by letting you take a look at the schematics of our Cruiser... well, you can see it adrift in our orbit, yes?"

choice.text: Why did we get boarded by Vampweeds?
Why did we get boarded by Vampweeds?

event.name: QUEST_OFFER_IVAR_PLUS_TYEREL
event.text: "We were compromised. The Confederacy is rife with Coalition sympathizers... but your arrival shifted the balance of power here back into our favor. We're not out of the woods yet, though... something terrible is about to happen. The Coalition would not have targeted us without a motive! We have reason to believe Premier Ivar, Secretary Ayr and Ambassador Ty E'Rel are in danger."

"What, you need a reason to save our head of state or something? Ivar's appointment is something of a point of contention. His parentage is... disputed. Let's just say there's probably a reason he's so buddy-buddy with the Gathering. He's not the most professional either. Stubborn. A clown, really. As for E'Rel, he's pretty much the exact opposite. A life-time of mediating between two Orchid cultures has made him entirely stone-faced, but he's very well respected. Ayr is in Ivar's cabinet. A very polite, organized man who worked for the previous Premier."
"I'm not sure what we will be able to do after the attack... but we will do what we can. I just hope a civil war doesn't break out because of our involvement..."
"I'm not sure what we will be able to do after the attack... but we will do what we can. I just hope a civil war doesn't break out because of our involvement..."

event.name: VAMPWEED_SECURITY_OFFER_ASSISTANCE
event.text: "I may have buried the lede somewhat. They're not in the same place - Ivar and Ayr should be at Ivar's party hall on Tar'eyl. Ivar is so open that without us keeping tabs on him, I fear for his safety. Ayr is at least quite cautious, so hopefully he is safe. Still, we're not getting any responses from our homeworld, so please make haste!"

"As for Ty E'Rel, we believe that the Coalition is lying in wait for him to leave the Confederacy. If it got out that they attacked him in our sector, it would negatively affect their reputation. They're probably biding their time until he leaves. Ty keeps in contact with us, so we should be able to send you directly to his transponder - I'm sure you can flush them out yourself."

event.name: VAMPWEED_SECURITY_REQUISITION
event.text: "One last thing. Our requisition officer wants to speak with you. One moment." The director steps back and is replaced with a strangely cheerful Vampweed. "'ello there! If you're 'eading over to the 'omeworld to 'elp us out, surely you'll be needin' some supplies! What'd'ya like?"
"'ere you are! Best of luck!"
"'ere you are! Best of luck!"
"Want a buddy, then? I know just the person for the job!"

event.name: QUEST_OFFER_IVAR_ONLY
event.text: "We were compromised. The Confederacy is rife with Coalition sympathizers... but your arrival shifted the balance of power here back into our favor. We're not out of the woods yet... something terrible is about to happen. The Coalition would not have targeted us without a motive! We have reason to believe Premier Ivar and Secretary Ayr are in danger."

"What, you need a reason to save our head of state or something? Ivar's appointment is something of a point of contention. His parentage is... disputed. Let's just say there's probably a reason he's so buddy-buddy with the Gathering. He's not the most professional either. Stubborn. Ayr is in Ivar's cabinet. A very polite, organized man who worked for the previous Premier."
"I'm not sure what we will be able to do after the attack... but we will do what we can. I just hope a civil war doesn't break out because of our involvement..."
"I'm not sure what we will be able to do after the attack... but we will do what we can. I just hope a civil war doesn't break out because of our involvement..."

event.name: VAMPWEED_SECURITY_OFFER_ASSISTANCE_IVAR_ONLY
event.text: "They should be at Ivar's party hall on Tar'eyl. He's so open that without us keeping tabs on him, I fear for his safety. Ayr is at least quite cautious, so hopefully he is safe. Still, we're not getting any responses from our homeworld, so please make haste!"

event.name: VAMPWEED_HOMEWORLD_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The Vampweeds have warned you their Premier is in danger.

event.text: You arrive at Tar'eyl, the Vampweed Homeworld, and birthplace of both Orchid subspecies. In orbit near Ivar's last known position is a Cultivator Cruiser. You receive a hail from the planet.

You receive a private call from the planet. When you answer, a Vampweed politician appears on your viewscreen, looking exceptionally smug. "Welcome to our homeland, Plan B. Your arrival has only ensured our victory."

Alkali glares at the politician. "I always thhhought of you to be thhhe treacherous type, Ayr. As usual, my intuition was well founded."
Ayr's smug expression is replaced with a poker face. "You scientists are all alike. Pretentious. You knew nothing substantial, don't act like you had any idea."

"You have thhhe nerve to call me pretentious, as you intimidate me withhhh a creation of my own design?" Alkali gestures to the Cultivator ship trained on you. "What reason would thhhey ever have to attack us?"
"A tragic incident. The Federation Renegade had taken the Premier's dear friend hostage." Ayr shakes his head. "Those barbarians tortured you before they killed you. We did our best."

choice.text: Alkali turns to his personal communicator.

event.text:
"Thhhis is thhhhe man who represents you?" You notice Alkali had been hailing the Cultivator ship surreptitiously. "Do you share his low opinion of your people's intellect? Ivar may be silly, but he would not lie to you like thhhis."
Ayr looks shaken momentarily. "They... They are loyal, they would never..." But there is a momentary explosion - some unrest occurs among their ranks. One of the Cultivators defects to your side! It looks like the remainder of them are resolved to fight you.

"Oh, forgive my rudeness. I am Secretary Ayr. I regret to inform you that your campaign of terror is at an end. For the crime of assassinating our current Premier, we will have to put you to death. The people will need justice, and I intend to give it to them."

"Oh, don't worry, my friend. My personal investigators will do all they can to uncover exactly what the public needs to hear. And, as I said earlier, you won't be alive to share your side of the story." The Cultivator cruiser begins to charge weapons. "Goodbye, Renegade."

choice.text: Why don't we just go, and we forget this ever happened?

event.text: "Why not, indeed? I've already gotten what I want out of this. What a shame that we weren't able to avenge poor, dumb Ivar." Ayr chuckles, and it seems you're free to go.

event.name: VAMPWEED_HOMEWORLD_AYR_DEFEAT
event.text: You've vanquished the Cultivator Cruiser. However, as you're in the midst of finishing the fight, you receive another communique from Ayr's office. "I underestimated you... but if you think this is the end of it, you're mistaken! I will not be defeated!" He presses some buttons on his desk. "I have no doubt this will be traced back to me, but I will deal with that later, even if it divides my people!"
Moments later, Ivar's dining hall bursts into flames! It seems that Ayr has somehow signaled a Hellfire drone to burn it down!

choice.text: (Fireproof Crew) Send in your crew to find Ivar.
(Repair Drone) Send a repair drone into the fire.
(Fire Extinguishers) Use your ship's fire suppression on the party hall.
We can't help. Scrap the ship while you can.

event.name: LOCATE_IVAR_QUICKLY_SCAN
event.text: You quickly locate the premier. As soon as you do, however, the party hall bursts into flames! It seems that Ayr has somehow signaled a Hellfire drone to burn the place down!

choice.text: (Teleporter) Lock on to Ivar and teleport him onto your ship.
(Fireproof Crew) Send in your crew to find Ivar.
(Repair Drone) Send a repair drone into the fire.
(Fire Extinguishers) Use your ship's fire suppression on the party hall.
Can't help. Scrap the ship while you can.

event.name: SAVE_IVAR_GARRISON
event.text: Alkali is one step ahead of you. As you turn to him, he is using his communicator. "No time to talk. Send thhhe entire garrison as well as a scientist into Ivar's party hall and rescue him." You hear a brief protest, but Alkali interrupts. "Thhhhe research and embassy can go undefended for an hour or so. Thhhhis is a direct order." Moments later, an entire garrison of Shell troops swoop in around the flaming building. They immediately start coordinating the effort to put out the fire and begin rescuing the occupants. Eventually, a Shell soldier comes out of the building, with a small group of Vampweeds behind him. Among the survivors is Ivar, leaning against his spear as a walking stick.

event.name: TELEPORT_IVAR
event.text: You're able to find Ivar's exact location within the building as it begins to burn. You have more than enough time to teleport him and all the other people trapped inside out of the building. Ivar looks around, then breathes a sigh of relief once he realizes what happened.

event.name: SEND_CREW_TO_IVAR_FIREPROOF
event.text: Your crew charges into the building without fear of fire. They put out whatever fires they can. It's tricky, but in doing so, a path is forged straight to the survivors. Your crew leads them outside. Ivar stumbles out of the building leaning against your crew member.

event.name: SAVE_IVAR_REPAIR_DRONE
event.text: Your drone crashes into the building through a window. It quickly puts out any fires it encounters and locates the survivors. You order your drone to lead the survivors to the exit, where your crew are unblocking the barricades. Ivar stumbles out of the building leaning against his spear as a walking stick.

event.name: SAVE_IVAR_FIRE_EXTINGUISHERS
event.text: You aim your ship's fire suppression externally in an attempt to put out the fire. The suppression system is quickly able to snuff out the majority of the flames. With your ship's intervention, the on-site fire response team is able to perform an evacuation. Ivar stumbles out of the building leaning against his spear as a walking stick.

event.name: SEND_CREW_TO_IVAR_NORMAL
event.text: Your crew tries to enter, but they can't make it in time. The hall burns out before you can offer any assistance. The Vampweeds on the scene recognize your attempt to help, but unfortunately they don't appear to be very eager to interact with you. It seems they managed to clean up most of the fight, leaving you a small fraction of what remained.

event.name: ABANDON_IVAR
event.text: There's nothing you can do but watch. It's clear that the doors have been barricaded from the outside, meaning anybody inside was trapped. You take what you can and get out.

event.name: IVAR_SAVED
event.text: Ivar gives you a big smile as he lays his eyes on you. "Well hello there, savior! I'm sure I don't have to introduce myself." He gestures to himself with the ceremonial spear he's holding. "But I'm Ivar! Oh, no need to use my title. I'm just happy to be here. Well, If you don't mind I would like to use your screen for one moment, I have some... things to say."

Ivar makes a conference call to several figures in his cabinet. Ayr is there, and he does not look happy. Ivar folds his arms. "I couldn't help but notice that fire drone sent to burn down my dining hall. In fact, if I'm not mistaken, it looks like the signal was coming from the planet. Now, who do you think that could have been? Hm? Do you have something to say, Ayr?"
"We... we'll look into it..."
"'We'? No, I wouldn't want to burden you with this. In fact..." There is a knock on Ayr's door. "I think you're going to be very busy."
Ayr is taken away. Ivar talks for a minute or so with the rest of his cabinet, before calling a short recess. He turns back to you.

choice.text: Alkali wants to talk to his friend.

event.text:
Ivar's face is beaming. "Alkali, you cunning bastard, I should have known you'd swoop in like a hero! How have you been?"
Alkali looks happier than he usually seems. "Taking a sabbatical from my labwork to play space buccaneer, apparently. It must be Tuesday, because yet again I get to tell you 'I told you so'."
"What, you've never been stabbed in the back by a family-friend? Mr. High and Mighty Scientist Ball over here." The two have a laugh. Ivar turns to you. "Well now, as long as Alkali is on board, I wouldn't mind tagging along as well. What do you say?"

"Wonderful! After a career of getting backstabbed, a punch to the face will be very refreshing. Let me tidy up some business with my cabinet and I'll be ready to go. Oh, one more thing! I managed to secure you the right to salvage the ship the conspirators used against you. You can also have the blueprints, if you want."

choice.text: Scrap the ship as Ivar finishes his meeting.

event.text: "That's a shame. I was hoping to catch up with Alkali. You can hand me over to the CSA, and I'll be out of your hair. Oh, one more thing. I managed to secure you the right to salvage the ship the conspirators used against you. You can also have the blueprints, if you want."

"Hoo, meetings can be so stressful, huh? Always full of busywork and contention. I could use a break from it all. To think, the busybody in my cabinet wanted me dead. Politics is a little too spicy sometimes. You got room on that ship for me?"

"Wonderful! After a career of getting backstabbed, a punch to the face will be very refreshing. Let me tidy up some business with my cabinet and I'll be ready to go. Oh, one more thing! I managed to secure you the right to salvage the ship the conspirators used against you. You can also have the blueprints, if you want."

choice.text: Scrap the ship as Ivar finishes his meeting.

event.text: "That's a shame. Might have been nice to see some new faces. You can hand me over to the CSA, and I'll be out of your hair. Oh, one more thing. I managed to secure you the right to salvage the ship the conspirators used against you. You can also have the blueprints, if you want."

event.name: TYEREL_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The Orchid Ambassador is being shadowed.

event.text: Upon jumping in you notice Ty E'Rel's Ambassadorial Cruiser docked at a nearby spaceport. There's no immediate sign of the Coalition stalker.

His ship is deserted, but the call is rerouted and you're greeted by a visibly withered Orchid. Both of Ty E'Rel's heritages are identifiable, having notable traits from both the Florals and the Vampweeds. "Good day, Renegade. A Federation captain coming all this way to meet me? This must be important."

choice.text: Inform him about the potential attempt on his life.

event.text: "Unsurprising. I'll contact the station and see what they can find." Ty E'Rel types something into a terminal. The station lights up as its sensor array begins actively scanning the area, a probe launching from the station's bay. In response to this, a Coalition ship reveals itself and hails you.
With no Coalition plainly in sight, you decide not to bother.

event.name: TY_EREL_COALITION_HAIL
event.text: As you hail the Coalition Predator, you're greeted by the sight of a Mantis Bishop. "You have stuck your ugly nose where it doesn't belong, Renegade! The Hive has unfinished business with this meddlesome bureaucrat. This will be your one chance to escape death at our hands."

choice.text: Ask them why they hate Ty E'Rel.

event.text: "Pah, Renegades and their insipid curiosity." The Bishop hesitates, but then unloads into a furious rant. "The Hive was winning! When those simpering flowers joined the Federation, we thought it had no chance to affect the outcome of the war... That worthless shrub convinced the Confederacy to abandon us! We could win a hundred fights on the ground and never make up for the losses the Federation would inflict in a single space battle. Without their weapons, their shipyards, the Hive could never maintain a fleet to continue our conquest." The Bishop pounds the console viciously. He finishes with a cold remark. "His infestation must be burned from the galaxy, to send a message to all who would refuse an alliance with the Hive."

The Bishop aims a sharp appendage at you. "Had it not been for my queen, I would have killed him long ago. But she was convinced they would turn against us even more if we attacked their diplomats."
The Bishop spreads its appendages wide. "But the Coalition has shown her a new path... and now there is nothing holding us back!" The Coalition ship turns to face yours - it looks like a conflict is now inevitable! "You ask too many questions. You cannot be allowed to live!"
The Coalition ship is all too willing to engage in combat with you.
You decide not to mess with the Coalition, abandoning Ty E'Rel to his fate.

event.name: TY_EREL_RESCUE_CONFEDERACY
event.text: The Coalition Predator is vanquished. You get a message from Ty E'Rel as you scrap the Predator's remains.

The elderly plant appears on your viewscreen. He gives a very slight, gentle smile. "My compliments on the intervention. I was about to leave for a trip to the Gathering, which would surely be an opportune moment to strike. I would be more than happy to offer the schematics of my ship to the Federation."

event.name: TY_EREL_RECRUITMENT_CHOICE
event.text: "Hmm.... retirement, eventually. It never feels like the right time, what with the galaxy constantly trying to rip itself to pieces." He straightens his back stem, groaning. "I could help you out for a short time on the off chance you need an ambassador or just an experienced set of hands."
"I will report to your ship right away. Pleasure to make your acquaintance, Captain." Ty E'Rel walks onto your ship carrying stacks of books and documents.
"In that case, I will take my ship and head over to the Federation for the time being. Good travels."
